intro: Didiscus papuaense, commonly known as the Papua discoid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive disc-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Didiscus papuaense is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and unique floral structure.
